name: Caribbean-Style Fried Salmon Fritters
author: Andy A
summary: Adapted from fried Caribbean accras, which are made from salted cod. A recipe that my dad used to make on the occasional Sunday. I didn't have salted cod, so I substituted canned sockeye salmon and it turned out awesome.
ingredients: 2 (14.75 ounce) cans salmon, drained and flaked
directions: Mix flour, parsley, baking powder, salt, thyme, and cumin together in a large bowl
Add chopped onion and jalapeno pepper; mix again
Add eggs and salmon; mash salmon and mix until combined
Add water and stir into a very thick batter
Heat 1/4 inch oil in a frying pan just below the medium heat setting
Scoop up 1 tablespoon batter per fritter; drop carefully into the hot oil in batches of 3
Fry until golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes per side
Transfer to a dish lined with paper towels to drain
Repeat with remaining batter for about 16 fritters in total
